page.title: 08RABBIT FARMING
page.content: My rabbits are kept in separate hutches. In summer they eat dandelions and bread, and have hay for bedding. In winter they eat Quaker oats and have straw for bedding. I feed them morning and night and clean them out once a week unless the doe has babies when I might harm them. When the doe and the buck are mating they are kept together for a month. then the buck is taken out in case he eats the babies. The doe has a batch of about sixteen babies. I keep one kind of rabbit called New Zealand white. These are worth more. I breed them for pets. I go to market once a year when the rabbits are six or seven months old. We get up to Â£5 for one or up to Â£35 for a doe and a buck.
